alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 22 at 11:30AM AKST until December 24 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FOR WHITTIER AND TURNAGAIN PASS FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 AM AKST SUNDAY ... * WHAT...Snow and Blizzard-like conditions. Visibility as low as one quarter mile at times. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 24 inches. Easterly winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Whittier, Turnagain Pass. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 3 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow with snow rates in excess of 1 inch/hour is expected. Warming temperatures may result in a transition to rain Saturday night and Sunday for Whittier. Conditions will improve Saturday afternoon before worsening again with another around of precipitation Saturday night. Rain or a rain/snow mix is likely for Whittier. Turnagain Pass and areas south along the Seward highway will again see heavy snow and an increase in wind. This will result in reduced visibility and slick conditions on untreated surfaces.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
